channel.description: Featuring Web development, Hardware Hacking, Pinball and more...

item.title: Running your own CardDav / CalDav Server
item.dc:creator: tobi
item.description: For years I’ve been running my own CalDav/CardDav server to sync my Contacts, Calendars and Reminders across all my devices. I’ve been very happy with DAViCal, until recently, I had to switch to a simple vhost which doesn’t offer PostgreSQL and custom apache cfgs. So I did some research which other implementations may be useful, […]
item.content:encoded:
For years I’ve been running my own CalDav/CardDav server to sync my Contacts, Calendars and Reminders across all my devices. I’ve been very happy with DAViCal, until recently, I had to switch to a simple vhost which doesn’t offer PostgreSQL and custom apache cfgs. So I did some research which other implementations may be useful, those are most promising ones:

Radicale (Python + Mysql)
http://radicale.org

Ba√Økal (PHP + Mysql)
based on SabreDav
http://baikal-server.com

SabreDav (PHP + Mysql)
DAV Framework,
https://code.google.com/p/sabredav

DAViCal (PHP + PostgreSQL)
Very complete, but not that easy to install.
http://www.davical.org

Other:
Apple CalendarServer: http://trac.calendarserver.org

See full list:
http://caldav.calconnect.org/implementations/servers.html

item.title: How to deal with recurrency in Ruby & Rails
item.dc:creator: tobi
item.description: I did a short eval of projects dealing with re currency in Ruby and Ruby on Rails. Here a short list & rough of interesting projects dealing with repeating time (intervals): Common used lilbrary: http://runt.rubyforge.org A better runt(?): http://github.com/nickstenning/recurring_event Date extension, yahoo dev, rspec like: http://github.com/jhubert/ruby-date-recur http://recurring.rubyforge.org http://github.com/EdvardM/recurrence http://github.com/fnando/recurrence Check this as well: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/85699/whats-the-best-way-to-model-recurring-events-in-a-calendar-application
item.content:encoded:
I did a short eval of projects dealing with re currency in Ruby and Ruby on Rails. Here a short list & rough of interesting projects dealing with repeating time (intervals):

Common used lilbrary: http://runt.rubyforge.org
A better runt(?): http://github.com/nickstenning/recurring_event
Date extension, yahoo dev, rspec like: http://github.com/jhubert/ruby-date-recur

http://recurring.rubyforge.org
http://github.com/EdvardM/recurrence
http://github.com/fnando/recurrence

Check this as well:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/85699/whats-the-best-way-to-model-recurring-events-in-a-calendar-application
